io.github.trulyfree.modular8.action.handlers

Class GeneralizedActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.trulyfree.modular8.action.handlers.GeneralizedActionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Action, ActionGroup<Action>, ActionHandler<Action>, ModifiableActionGroup<Action>, Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackgroundGeneralizedActionHandler

    public class GeneralizedActionHandler
extends Object
implements ActionHandler<Action>
    GeneralizedActionHandler class. This class handles all currently held actions synchronously whenever "enact" is called. This action handler is thread safe.
    Author:
    vtcakavsmoace

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<Action> list
      A list defining the known actions, all of which will be enacted whenever enact is called.

    • Method Detail

      • addAction

        public boolean addAction(Action action)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to add an Action to this ActionGroup. Implementations which extend existing List implementations should find this method to be a single call.
        Specified by:
        addAction in interface ModifiableActionGroup<Action>
        Parameters:
        action - The Action to add to the ActionGroup.
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of the add operation. Note that if a throwable is thrown by this method, it should be caught and the method return false.

      • removeAction

        public boolean removeAction(Action action)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to remove an Action from this ActionGroup. Implementations which extend existing List implementations should find this method to be very simple to implement.
        Specified by:
        removeAction in interface ModifiableActionGroup<Action>
        Parameters:
        action - The Action to remove from the ActionGroup.
        Returns:
        removed The Action removed by this operation.

      • enactNextAction

        public boolean enactNextAction()
        Description copied from interface: ActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to enact the next Action contained by this ActionGroup. This method should be preferred over iterating through the children and executing them individually in an external class.
        Specified by:
        enactNextAction in interface ActionGroup<Action>
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of the action enacted.

      • getActions

        public Collection<Action> getActions()
        Description copied from interface: ActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to retrieve the actions held by this ActionGroup, including those already enacted. The collection returned should NOT be capable of modifying the ActionGroup's internal Action collection. If the ActionGroup is intended to be modifiable, the user should implement the ModifiableActionGroup interface.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ActionGroup<Action>
        Returns:
        actions The actions of this ActionGroup. Note that modifications to this collection should NOT modify the actions of the ActionGroup.

      • setup

        public boolean setup()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Method to be called in order to set up the module for proper use. All implementations should catch all throwables within the implementation of setup and return false if they are thrown unintentionally. This allows for usage of the module in various projects, should that be intended. Furthermore, all set up for the module instance should occur in this method in preference to the module implementation's constructor or through the use of anonymous methods.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface Module
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of the setup. Should be false if a throwable is thrown or if the setup is in any other way unsuccessful.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Method to be called in order to verify that the module is ready for proper use. It is highly recommended that all implementations return false for this method should the method setup not have been called and/or the method destroy has been called.
        Specified by:
        isReady in interface Module
        Returns:
        ready A boolean representing the readiness of the instance. If the setup method has not been called and/or the destroy method has been called, or if for any other reason the module is not ready to be used, this should return false.

      • destroy

        public boolean destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Method to be called in order to destroy, or clean up, the module to prevent unnecessary background processing or RAM usage. It is suggested that all instance values should be set to null or zero values when this method is called. It is also suggested that this method should not return false, but instead continue to attempt the destruction of the module before any further action continues on the thread.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Module
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of destruction.

      • size

        public int size()
        Description copied from interface: ActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to check the number of actions held by this ActionGroup in total, including those already enacted.
        Specified by:
        size in interface ActionGroup<Action>
        Returns:
        size The number of actions held by this ActionGroup.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to remove all Actions from this ActionGroup. A suggested implementation has been provided. Implementations may differ according to need.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface ModifiableActionGroup<Action>

      • enact

        public boolean enact()
        Description copied from interface: Action
        Method to be called in order to enact the operations desired. Think of this method as synonymous with Runnable's "run", except that this returns a boolean if the operation is successful. This method should not cause any throwables to be thrown. Instead, all throwables should be handled within this method. If the action is cancelled, throws a fatal throwable, or is for any other reason not successfully completed, it should catch any thrown throwables and return false.
        Specified by:
        enact in interface Action
        Returns:
        success The success of this operation. If the action fails to be enacted for any reason, this should return false.

      • removeActionByType

        public Collection<Action> removeActionByType(Class<? extends Action> type)
        Description copied from interface: ModifiableActionGroup
        Method to be called in order to remove Actions of a specific type from this ActionGroup. A suggested implementation has been provided, but implementations may differ on the approach chosen.
        Specified by:
        removeActionByType in interface ModifiableActionGroup<Action>
        Parameters:
        type - The type of Action to remove. Note that this should respect polymorphism.
        Returns:
        removed The Action(s) removed by this operation. If no actions are removed, this should return an empty collection of Actions.
